I made the rover work on the Mun by adjusting the suspension/traction/braking settings on my rover wheels.

I've successfully landed a rover on Duna, and I'm trying madly not to flip the thing. Has anyone got any tips for a small rover with RoveMax M1 wheels?

What settings give me the best control?

Action group for turning on and off the reaction wheels, if you have them (off for driving so it doesn't wiggle forward when pushing throttle, on when needed when getting air or flipping it back on wheels).

But you know, Duna has stronger gravity than the Mun so in theory it should be easier.

Tip: 1 m/s=~2.25 mph. 

So either take it slow or design your rover to be a baja racer
